summary: The document is a confidential memorandum from the Chief of the Domestic Collection Division to the Chief of the Miami Field Office, dated 11 March 1977. It pertains to Case 57845, involving an unidentified man whose photograph was published in the Warren Commission report on the assassination of President Kennedy. The man visited the Cuban and Soviet Embassies in Mexico City in October 1963. The memorandum requests assistance in identifying the man and mentions a former member of the Cuban General Directorate of Intelligence (DGI) identified him as Yuri, a KGB officer. Yuri was described as a fluent English and Spanish speaker, acting as a troubleshooter for a Cuban group in Moscow in 1964.
key_findings: The document seeks information on an unidentified man linked to the Cuban and Soviet Embassies in Mexico City in October 1963.
A former DGI member identified the man as Yuri, a KGB officer, who was fluent in English and Spanish and acted as a troubleshooter for a Cuban group in Moscow in 1964.
Yuri was associated with a KGB officer known as Juan, who had extensive experience in Mexico and the US.
The document highlights the international intelligence connections and operations during the Cold War era, particularly around the time of President Kennedy's assassination.
